instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT: What is PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT? Power rail for RAM. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> RAM Beeping
threads.message:
[LEFT][COLOR=#555555][FONT=inherit]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> clean board RAM beep sound at startup, I already gave the 4 RAM chips a reflow but same issue.

I don't thinks this boards are known for RAM issues, any guidance will be greatly appreciated.[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> RAM Beeping
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> is present at RAM Caps
<SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> present

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> RAM Beeping
threads.message:
You are not the first with same in issue in this board.
Could be bad RAM chip, which cannot be solved by reflow.
Can also be broken trace/solder under CPU, or a RAM chip.
You can try reball, or change RAM chips.
This will not help if problem is on CPU side...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> RAM Beeping
threads.message: Thanks, there are 4 chips and also there is <CHIP>U4000</CHIP>, should I also replace <CHIP>U4000</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> RAM Beeping
threads.message: <CHIP>U4000</CHIP> is dedicated for camera, not involved here...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> RAM Beeping
threads.message:
Put new RAM chips and same problem, this board is RIP
Thanks for help!
